subject:
Re: [cc-community] Strayform - where artists and fans connect
	tofund and distribute new creative works
body:
> I would suggest building into your plan somehow the "beyond music" strategy
> of the Chinese, so artists using your site don't expect to make money from> the fans for the music directly.  There should be something else,> merchandising or signed pictures or whatever.

That is one option, but I think setting a price at which you will release atrack with a Free license (say CC BY-SA for the sake of argument) is worth anexperiment. If I can get some people together willing to record this way, I
will run some experiments along these lines.FYI, Antenna Alliance, a CC recording project out of Boston, MA and expanding to other cities is recording bands free of cost and promoting the music to college radio stations in exchange for releasing the music under CC licenses. (They are very heavily promoting  CC BY and BY-SA and as a result, most, but not all of the music is under those licenses).
The site is still in the works, but you can find out more info at www.antalliance.org.
